C1 violent action organized by a group of people who are trying to change the political system in their country: The government has brutally crushed the rebellion.
action against those in authority, against the rules, or against normal and accepted ways of behaving: a backbench rebellion against the new foreign policy her teenage rebellion

Taking action against people in power

violent action organized by a group of people who refuse to accept their government’s power and are willing to use force to oppose it: [ C ] The African-American Nat Turner led an 1831 rebellion.
Rebellion is also a feeling of strong disagreement with an organization or with people in authority: [ U ] Many students were in rebellion against the older generation.
